name: postposition
content:

in grammar, a word that is used after a word or phrase that it is related to, or the fact of coming in this position: Hungarian has several ways of encoding spatial relations: suffixes, postpositions, verbal prefixes, and adverbs. In Old English, only postposition seems to have been possible with these two adverbs.
More examplesFewer examplesWithin this group, there is variation in both the preposition and postposition. The system of postpositions is used to express relations that are cognitively more complex than those expressed by suffixes.
